# AtUri { #atdata.atmosphere.AtUri }

```python
atmosphere.AtUri(authority, collection, rkey)
```

Parsed AT Protocol URI.

AT URIs follow the format: at://<authority>/<collection>/<rkey>

Example:
    >>> uri = AtUri.parse("at://did:plc:abc123/ac.foundation.dataset.sampleSchema/xyz")
    >>> uri.authority
    'did:plc:abc123'
    >>> uri.collection
    'ac.foundation.dataset.sampleSchema'
    >>> uri.rkey
    'xyz'

## Attributes

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [authority](#atdata.atmosphere.AtUri.authority) | The DID or handle of the repository owner. |
| [collection](#atdata.atmosphere.AtUri.collection) | The NSID of the record collection. |
| [rkey](#atdata.atmosphere.AtUri.rkey) | The record key within the collection. |

## Methods

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [parse](#atdata.atmosphere.AtUri.parse) | Parse an AT URI string into components. |

### parse { #atdata.atmosphere.AtUri.parse }

```python
atmosphere.AtUri.parse(uri)
```

Parse an AT URI string into components.

Args:
    uri: AT URI string in format ``at://<authority>/<collection>/<rkey>``

Returns:
    Parsed AtUri instance.

Raises:
    ValueError: If the URI format is invalid.
